data: Funerary inscription for Aphrodito, a mime actress
A white marble plaque, apparently complete: the upper and lower edges are regular, the left and right sides irregular. The rear is finished and smooth.

Latin text over six lines, roughly centred on the plaque. Lines
                                    1-3 are more widely spaced and better centred; lines 4-6 are more compressed in
                                    the lower right.

Letters show some tendency to a cursive style, but the name in line 2
                                    is notably marked out in a more classical majuscule style. One instance of ligature
                                    in line 6. Use of simple hedera as interpuncts in lines 3-6.
2nd century CE or beginning of 3rd century CE

Found c.1731 in the foundations of the Church of S.Caterina da Siena
                                (known as S. Caterina del Rosario), previously attached to the convent of the Dominican
                                Fathers, today seat of the Archivio di Stato, at via S.Agata 2.
Photograph by Liceo Artistico Statale "M. M. Lazzaro" di Catania
Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae

funerary inscription for aphrodito, a mime actress
ISic000330. Funerary inscription for Aphrodito, a mime actress

2Aphrodito

4ann(is) ❦ XXXX ❦
5Eutychus ❦ con - ❦
6iugi ❦ merent͡i f(ecit)

Dis Manibus sacrum Aphrodito mimas vixit annis XXXX Eutychus coniugi merenti fecit

1DMS
2APHRODITO
3MIMAS❦VIX❦
4ANN❦XXXX❦
5EUTYCHUS❦CON- ❦
6IUGI❦MERENT͡IF

DISMANIBUSSACRUMAPHRODITOMIMASVIXITANNISXXXXEUTYCHUSCONIUGIMERENTIFECIT

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based on autopsy

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Sacred to the spirits of the underworld. Aphrodito the mime lived for 40 years. Eutychus (set this up) for his deserving wife.

Italian translation

Serena Agodi

Consacrato agli Dei Mani. La mima Aphrodito visse 40 anni. Eutychus (lo costruì) per la meritevole moglie.

commentary

Aphrodito (LGPN V3A: 37802) is a rare female name, most commonly found in northern Greece / Macedonia. Mimas copies the Greek word μιμάς designating a mime actor. Mime, a highly successful form of popular, comic drama, had its first real success in fifth-century BC Sicily, and was very popular in Rome and Italy throughout the later Republic and Imperial period. Ancient mime has however only come down to us in fragments. The genre flourished in the Hellenistic east also, and Aphrodito’s name suggests that she may have come from the eastern Mediterranean to practice her art in Sicily and Italy.

For online Italian edition see EpiCUM420
